Package File_formats

Class Csv2kml

  • java.lang.Object
    • File_formats.Csv2kml

  • public class Csv2kml
extends java.lang.Object
    a static class used for Converting CVS files to a GIS objects (GIS_project | GIS_layer | GIS_element) and for converting GIS objects to KML files.
    Note: using "CsvReader", "MultiCSV" and "BuildKML classes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void createKMLFile​(GIS_layer layer, java.lang.String pathname)
      creates a KML file from given GIS_layer object.
      static void createKMLFile​(GIS_project project, java.lang.String pathname)
      creates a KML file from given GIS_project object.
      static GIS_project readCSVDirectory​(java.lang.String DirPathName)
      Reading multiple CSV files from a given directory path, scanning the given directory path and its sub-directories for CSV files converting them into a CSV_layers using "CsvReader.read(String)", the function would stack them up in a GISProject set and eventually return it.
      static GIS_layer readCSVFile​(java.lang.String CSVPathName)
      Reading a CSV file from a given file's relative path, converts it into a GIS_layer
      Note: using relative path name.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • readCSVFile

        public static GIS_layer readCSVFile​(java.lang.String CSVPathName)
        Reading a CSV file from a given file's relative path, converts it into a GIS_layer
        Note: using relative path name.
        Note: in case of invalid or wrong path file name, the function would print an error stack trace and return NULL.
        Note: can read a single file, for multiple files use "readCSVDirectory(String)".
        Note: read more in "CsvReader.read(String)" function.
        Parameters:
        CSVPathName - the file path to read, Example: "Wiggle20171354.csv" or "src/Data/junk/Wiggle20171354.csv".
        Returns:
        GIS_layer object converted from the CSV file.

      • readCSVDirectory

        public static GIS_project readCSVDirectory​(java.lang.String DirPathName)
        Reading multiple CSV files from a given directory path, scanning the given directory path and its sub-directories for CSV files converting them into a CSV_layers using "CsvReader.read(String)", the function would stack them up in a GISProject set and eventually return it.
        Note: the function is making use of "MultiCSV.readDirectory(String)" function. Note: using relative path.
        Parameters:
        DirPathName - the directory path to scan for CSV files, Example: "src/Data/junk/"
        Returns:
        GIS_layer object converted from the CSV file.

      • createKMLFile

        public static void createKMLFile​(GIS_project project,
                                 java.lang.String pathname)
        creates a KML file from given GIS_project object.
        Parameters:
        project - GIS_project type
        pathname - relative path filename with Path+FileName+File Extension, EX: "Src/Data/myKML.kml"

      • createKMLFile

        public static void createKMLFile​(GIS_layer layer,
                                 java.lang.String pathname)
        creates a KML file from given GIS_layer object.
        Parameters:
        layer - GIS_layer type
        pathname - relative path filename with Path+FileName+File Extension, EX: "Src/Data/myKML.kml"
